weka.classifiers.collective.util

Class CollectiveInstances

  • java.lang.Object
    • weka.classifiers.collective.util.CollectiveInstances
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class CollectiveInstances
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A helper class for initializing labels and flipping class labels.
    Version:
    $Revision: 2019 $
    Author:
    Fracpete (fracpete at waikato dot ac dot nz)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int COMPARE_ACC_TRAIN
      the accuracy on the training set is used for comparing models
      static int COMPARE_RMS
      the RMS is used for comparing models
      static int COMPARE_RMS_TEST
      the RMS on the test set is used for comparing models
      static int COMPARE_RMS_TRAIN
      the RMS on the training set is used for comparing models
      static Tag[] COMPARE_TAGS
      the tags to select in the GUI
      static int EVAL_HILLCLIMBING
      we perform sort of hillclimbing by always using the best model
      static int EVAL_RANDOMWALK_BEST
      we perform a random walk, but use the best model encountered for prediction
      static int EVAL_RANDOMWALK_LAST
      we perform a random walk and use the last model for prediction
      static Tag[] EVAL_TAGS
      the tags to select in the GUI

      flips labels in the part of the given set where the probability is close to 0.5

      • initializeLabels

        public Instances initializeLabels(Instances train,
                                  Instances instances)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        randomly initializes the class labels in the given set according to the class distribution in the training set
        Parameters:
        train - the training instances to retrieve the class distribution from
        instances - the instances to initialize
        Returns:
        the initialize instances
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if something goes wrong

                                  Instances instances,
                                  int from,
                                  int count)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        randomly initializes the class labels in the given set according to the class distribution in the training set
        Parameters:
        train - the training instances to retrieve the class distribution from
        instances - the instances to initialize
        from - the first instance to initialize
        count - the number of instances to initialize
        Returns:
        the initialize instances
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if something goes wrong

      • flipLabels

        public Instances flipLabels(Classifier c,
                            Instances instances,
                            FlipHistory history)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        flips labels in the part of the given set where the probability is close to 0.5
        Parameters:
        c - the current collective classifier
        instances - the instances to work on
        history - the flipping history
        Returns:
        the flipped instances
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if something goes wrong

      • flipLabels

        public Instances flipLabels(Classifier c,
                            Instances instances,
                            int from,
                            int count,
                            FlipHistory history)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        flips labels in the part of the given set, with the current flipping' algorithm.
        Parameters:
        c - the current collective classifier
        instances - the instances to work on
        from - the first instance to flip
        count - the number of instances to flip
        history - the flipping history
        Returns:
        the flipped instances
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if something goes wrong
        See Also:
        setFlipper(Flipper)

      • calculateRMS

        public static double[] calculateRMS(Classifier c,
                                    Instances train,
                                    Instances test,
                                    Instances testOriginal)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        calculates the RMS for test/original test and train set
        Parameters:
        c - the classifier to use for determining the RMS
        train - the training set
        test - the test set
        testOriginal - the original test set (can be null)
        Returns:
        the RMS array (contains RMS, RMSTrain, RMSTest, RMSTestOriginal)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if something goes wrong

      • calculateAccuracy

        public static double[] calculateAccuracy(Classifier c,
                                         Instances train,
                                         Instances test)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        calculates the accuracy for original test and train set
        Parameters:
        c - the classifier to use for determining the RMS
        train - the training set
        test - the original test set
        Returns:
        the accuracy array (contains AccTrain, AccTestOriginal)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if something goes wrong
